intro: Corchorus cordifolius, commonly known as Indian mallow or heartleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used traditionally in various medicinal and textile applications.
